rationale: This 8-bar arrangement uses only triads (capped jazz_harmony at 3/10) and lacks 7th chords or extensions. The hihat plays only on downbeats (capped latin_jazz_rhythm at 3/10) with no upbeat syncopation, creating a straight-time feel rather than Latin jazz. The saxophone melody (4/10) is repetitive and lacks phrasing or development, sounding mechanical. The interplay (4/10) is weak with all instruments starting together in bar 1 and no progressive build. The arrangement feels technically correct but lacks the soul and authenticity of true jazz, missing groove, swing, and improvisational elements.
suggestions: Bar 1: ONLY hihat should play. All other instruments rest.
Bars 2-4: Add snare and bass. Piano and sax still rest.
Bars 5-8: Full ensemble enters with piano 7th chords and memorable sax melody.
Replace ALL piano triads with 7th chords (e.g., Cmaj7, Dm7, G7) in bars 1-8.
Increase hihat upbeat syncopation to >60% (hit more 'and's, skip more downbeats).
prompt_mutation: Emphasize progressive arrangement structure more strongly. Add quantitative requirements: Bar 1 = hihat ONLY, Bars 2-4 = rhythm section ONLY (no piano/sax), Bars 5-8 = full ensemble. Make it impossible to ignore.
